item.title: Call of Duty Is January 2025's Top-Selling Game According to US Sales Data
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/call-of-duty-january-2025-circana-us-sales-data

Circana has released its US gaming industry sales data for January 2025, and given that it's a month without many significant releases, the number one seller for the month probably won't surprise you.

As noted in a Bluesky thread by Circana's Mat Piscatella, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is once again the month's biggest-selling game across all platforms. Perhaps unsurprisingly, the game was also 2024's top-selling title by Circana's reckoning.

In second place for the all-format chart is Madden NFL 25, which isn't surprising given the colossal commercial success of that franchise and EA Sports College Football, while Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth is in third, bolstered by its January PC release. Perhaps now, it can strive to meet Square Enix's expectations.

Rounding out the all-format top five are EA Sports FC 25, which underperformed compared to EA's expectations, and Minecraft, which probably couldn't be said to have underperformed by any expectations in the known universe.

When it comes to specific formats, Black Ops 6 tops the PlayStation chart for January, while Madden NFL 25 tops the Xbox chart. As always, the Switch is dancing to its own tune; Nintendo's chart is dominated by Donkey Kong Country Returns.

As for player engagement - that is, games on each platform ranked by monthly active users - Fortnite is top of the chart on PlayStation, while Call of Duty tops Xbox's chart. Marvel Rivals, which recently hit 40 million players, is number one on Steam.

Spending as a whole across the industry fell by 15% compared to the same period last year, although as Piscatella points out, January 2025 consists of four weeks rather than last year's five-week tracking period.

Hardware-wise, the PS5 emerged victorious once again in January, beating out the Xbox and Switch in units and dollar sales. Xbox was second in dollar sales, while Switch came second in units.

As ever, Piscatella's full thread is well worth a look if you want to see some other stats. You can check the thread out here.

item.title: Hades 2 Developer Says It Won't Recast Voice Actors or Use AI
item.content:encoded:
https://techraptor.net/gaming/news/hades-2-supergiant-recast-statement

Hades 2 developer Supergiant Games has released a statement responding to a voice actor's recent suggestion that they may be recast owing to the ongoing SAG-AFTRA strike.

Earlier this week, voice actor Marin Miller, who voices characters like Athena in Hades and its sequel, said via Bluesky that followers "may hear me get recast in a particular game that is very popular" because "the employer refused to flip to an interim".

In a followup post, Miller made it very clear they were referring to Supergiant, stating that "it would be SUPER helpful if you wrote a GIANT email asking them to flip for their actors". By "flip", Miller presumably means they want Supergiant to put an interim agreement in place to allow them to continue working through the strike.

Responding - albeit indirectly - to Miller's post on Bluesky, Supergiant says it hasn't recast any of its Hades 2 actors and that it doesn't intend to do so. The studio also says it "ha[s] respected and will continue to respect any actor needing to pause work" due to the strike.

Supergiant then says that none of its games have been subject to SAG-AFTRA contracts "for a variety of reasons", but that its own contracts "offer the strongest AI protections in the industry" and that its games are "intentionally made by human beings", pledging not to use generative AI in the creation of Hades 2.

So far, it doesn't look like Miller has responded to Supergiant on social media. It's possible we may hear from them in the coming days, or that Miller has decided to contact Supergiant directly to continue the dialog.

As for Hades 2 itself, development on the game continues apace. Released in Early Access in May last year, the game sees Princess of the Underworld Melinoë battling the forces of Chronos, the Titan of Time.

Earlier this week, Supergiant released the Warsong Update for Hades 2, adding a number of new features to the game. You can check out the full patch notes for that update right here.

Hades 2 is available right now for PC via Steam Early Access. You can check out our very own Tyler's preview of the game here if you want to know how it stacks up compared to its predecessor.
